holidays.name: National Curried Chicken Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to celebrating the spicy, savory, and aromatic delights of curried chicken dishes across the globe.
holidays.origin: While curry has ancient roots in Indian cuisine, this unofficial food holiday emerged in the U.S. to honor the many variations of curried chicken.
holidays.funFact: Did you know that curry powder was actually a British invention inspired by Indian cooking? The term 'curry' comes from the Tamil word 'kari', meaning sauce.

holidays.name: Marzipan Day
holidays.description: A sweet celebration honoring the almond-flavored confection known for its firm and moldable texture that‚Äôs perfect for making candies and decorations.
holidays.origin: Marzipan originated in the Middle East and has been a favorite European treat since the Middle Ages, especially in Germany and Italy.
holidays.funFact: Marzipan is often sculpted into tiny fruits and animals as edible artwork, especially popular in holiday celebrations!

holidays.name: International Kiss A Ginger Day
holidays.description: A quirky and affectionate day encouraging people to celebrate and embrace those with red hair by giving them a friendly kiss.
holidays.origin: This playful phenomenon started on social media and gained popularity as a way to celebrate redheads and break stereotypes.
holidays.funFact: Redheads have a unique genetic trait, carrying the MC1R gene variant, and make up only 1-2% of the global population.

holidays.name: National Glitch Day
holidays.description: A fun nod to those odd computer errors, technological hiccups, and unexpected bugs in software that can be frustrating or hilarious.
holidays.origin: Tech enthusiasts created this day to highlight the quirks and unpredictability of digital glitches.
holidays.funFact: The famous ‚ÄòBlue Screen of Death‚Äô is one of the most iconic glitches, signaling a critical system error on Windows computers.
